TopicTitle: Fjord Model B Cargo Truck [Stunt Car in Disguise]

Articles.Content:
Fjord Motor Co Model B - Cargo Truck

Rough. Tough. Buff. Stuf- (Okay, Jeb, that's enough) [sorry!]

Fleshed out interior. It even has cupholders!

Engine block meant to give some serious raw power.

The Model B is incredibly useful for carrying cargo. It's got two rear hitches (attachment nodes) and one in the front.

If you're Jeb, this is what you'll use "payload capacity" for.

The front node can be used for the crew deployment mechanism. But it can be used for other stuff too.

Though convenient, the Model B's engineers designed the car to secretly be an incredibly competent stunt vehicle. Jumping off the launchpad, crawlerway jumps, rough landings, it's all doable in the Model B.

(GIF may be sped up a bit)

Amusingly, at 131 beats per minute, this GIF loops for quarter notes.

So, if you're listening to Party Rock Anthem (or a parody soundtrack of it), you'll have it set the beat.

It also comes with ladders for easy boarding/disembarking.

Grab a key and take it for a test drive!

DOWNLOAD

Edited August 27, 2015 by Starwhip

One of your passengers isn't having a good time. Good thing those mugs are their.... oh wait they spilled from all the stunts... Another great addition to the Fjord company in which has been open for about 2 weeks and counting

Amusingly, at 131 beats per minute, this GIF loops for quarter notes.

So, if you're listening to Party Rock Anthem (or a parody soundtrack of it), you'll have it set the beat.

I'm glad you're having some fun with trucks. Now get back to work, mister!

With all due seriousness, I love your recent creations, Starwhip. I'm especially fond of the little levers and knobbly bits that are in some of your cockpits, machine guns, etc. Can you tell me how you did those? Pretty please?

Oh, and apparently I must spread some reputation around before giving it to you again. Otherwise, you would totally have another chunk of my +Rep for your engineering. Sorry...

-Upsilon

With all due seriousness, I love your recent creations, Starwhip. I'm especially fond of the little levers and knobbly bits that are in some of your cockpits, machine guns, etc. Can you tell me how you did those? Pretty please?

-Upsilon

Step One - Attach Communotron 16 to craft near desired point.

Step Two - Hit "3" to activate rotation gizmo, then rotate the antenna until it's in the right orientation (Usually 180* or more). The knobbly bit is the base of this antenna.

Step Three - Without deselecting the antenna, hit "2" to activate slide gizmo, then position it in the right spot.

Step Four - Profit.
